moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Nf6 3. c4 e6: The Icelandic. White choosed the worst move, c4, the one the opening was intended against.
moves.5... Bb4: ? Here, theory recommends Qe2, even blocking the dsb, as a prelude to Bxc4. I'm not in a hurry, but this move is just a loss of time.
moves.6. Qa4+: Which white, wisely, takes advantage of.
moves.7... Bd6 8. b4: Ok, it's now or never. If I just admit my mistake, I'll be crushed. I have to react.
moves.8... Qe7 9. b5: The temptation of such a good move is too big. But this gives me a not forced, but still overwhelming attack.
moves.9... Bxc4+: Delightful. This bishop will stay there for long.
moves.10. Kf2: Would be a good idea, but for...
moves.10... Bc5+ 11. Kg3: Qe5 comes inmediately to mind. I preferred...
Bf2+ looked wonderful, but I didn't want the king to escape in f5. I was not sure of the mate yet, but it was obviously somewhere ahead. With this move, white has f4, but this just blocks the square all the same.
moves.15. Kh4 Qf2+ 16. Kh3: In this square I have no inmediate threat, but...
moves.16... h5: I still have a tempo. White can do nothing.
moves.17. bxc6 hxg4#: A problem-like checkmate. Thank you for reading.
